alert.note: Alert for Placer; Sutter; Yuba (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 10 at 4:28PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central California, including the following counties, Placer, Sutter and Yuba. * WHEN...Until 545 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 424 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.2 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Roseville, Tudor, Nicolaus, Arboga, Olivehurst, Pleasant Grove, and Sutter. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
